title: Practice Grenade
abstract: Once, this training fuse safely simulated a Vietnam-era fragmentation grenade. Now the object is used for those practicing drawing in Fine Arts classes at IU South Bend.

title: Sculptural Ash Tray
abstract:
Airplane and decorations made of ammunition, probably from World War II.   
Loaned by Dr. Dave Vollrath (IU South Bend faculty)

title: Decorated Shell Case
abstract:
75mm brass cartridge commemorating the Battle of Soissons (France) during World War I.  
Loaned by Dr. Dave Vollrath (IU South Bend faculty)

title: “Dear Mother”
abstract: Like many soldiers, US Marine Corps Corporal Donald Alfred Herrick wrote a letter to home before being shipped off to France in World War I. The artist pulled out and expanded certain passages written by her grandfather that would have carried special meaning to his family as they passed around his missive again and again, hoping for his eventual safe return.

title: Matchbox Case
abstract:
Pieces of a broken matchbox case, modified with trench art by a WWI soldier. the large piece (A) includes the top and backing of the box, and features a metal crown seal of the German forces. The back (B), which has broken off, features etched ornamentation that reads: "ACY Verdun". 
 
Worn and carried  by Charlie Robbins, Balloon Corps soldier, in World War I

title: Desert Storm Hot Weather Hat
abstract: United States Army - Operation Desert Storm hot weather hat in tan/desert camouflage

title: U.S. Army WWII Helmet
abstract: U.S. Army or U.S. Army Air Force steel helmet from WWII, no lining. Khaki cotton straps fastened with a brass hook and eye and adjustment brake. Straps fastened by welded loops to the helmet at the sides.

title: U.S. Army Paratrooper Helmet
abstract:
WORLD WAR II U.S. ARMY PARATROOPER HELMET. THE HELMET IS MADE FROM STEEL WHICH HAS BEEN PAINTED AN OLIVE DRAB GREEN ON THE OUTSIDE. THERE IS A LARGE WHITE BAR PAINTED ON THE BACK OF THE HELMET AND A SMALLER WHITE BAR PAINTED ON THE FRONT. THEY SYMBOLIZE A LIEUTENANT'S BAR. THERE IS A BLOTCH OF RED PAINT ON THE LEFT SIDE WHICH LOOKS SOMEWHAT LIKE A FIREBALL. THE INSIDE OF THE HELMET IS LINED WITH A METAL INSET WHICH IS PAINTED WITH LIGHT AND DARK BROWN 
STRIPES. A WEB OF LEATHER AND HEAVY…

title: Korean War Helmet
abstract: A Korean War U.S. Army steel combat helmet. The helmet liner is missing. Painted olive drab. Chin strap is olive color with a metal tab on the end. Worn by Julius De Maegd, U.S. Army, deployed in Korea.

title: Garrison Cap
abstract: Vietnam War Khaki cotton garrison cap. Eyelet on the left front for the insignia. Worn by P.D.  Scruggs, who was in the U.S. Marines, 1967-1971. Scruggs was deployed to Vietnam.

title: Shell Casing Lamp
abstract: Trench Art: Lamp made most likely from a World War I shell casing, though information dates the lamp to between WWI and WWII. Koa wood base. Shell has been embossed with a design of a Bird of Paradise, on a flower-trimmed limb. The shell casing is made of brass and nickel-plating over the design. Completed with three (3) etched and pressed glass shades.

title: WWI Helmet
abstract: U.S. Army WW1 helmet. Purchased by the Northern Indiana Historical Society, from Mrs. J.M. Wood of Warsaw, Indiana. This was originally part of the Vernon C. Keller Collection out of Bourbon, Indiana
